When interacting with toddlers or the elderly, the virtue of patience is indispensable. Mentally challenged individuals often struggle to comprehend or are reluctant to perform tasks, similar to toddlers. One should be patient with physically challenged individuals as certain tasks may be arduous for them to accomplish. In essence, patience is a manifestation of respect, while fear is not. Patience is a universal value that enriches our interactions with others and contributes to a more harmonious society.
